Hi Selva,
I've not been paying attention so somebody might have already sai=
d this.
Is the message you're getting similar to:
BUILD FAILED: C:\sandbox\=
code\build\build.xml:199: Could not create task or type of type: junit.

If=
 so you need to explicitly inform Ant within Eclipse where junit.jar is.  D=
o this by bringing up the Eclipse Ant configuration dialog (context menu "R=
un Ant..." on your xml file).  Go to the classpath tab and add an entry for=
 junit.jar (via "Add JARS...", or "Add External JARS..." button)

Jonathan
=

________________________________________
From: Bradley, Todd [mailto:todd.=
bradley@...] 
Sent: 11 March 2005 15:48
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
S=
ubject: RE: [junit] Ant could not create task : junit


> I had problems ru=
nning junit task and had to keep the junit jar
> (junit3.8.1.jar) in ant li=
b folder=A0 (ANT_HOME/lib) and use a 
> <classpath /> with all the ant lib =
jars added to it.
> 
> This works when I run the build script through ant f=
rom command line.
> The same build script will not work from within Eclipse=
. Not sure why.

It could be that when you're running ant from within Eclip=
se, you're not
using the ant you think you're using.=A0 That's happened to =
me before.=A0 By
default, Eclipse uses its own ant, which has its own ant/l=
ib, which
doesn't come with the JUnit jars in it.=A0 My solution was to con=
figure
Eclipse to use the same ant I used from outside Eclipse.


Todd.
